paragraphs.content: Psalm 68
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 68

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm or Song of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm or Song of David.

paragraphs.content: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.

paragraphs.content: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

paragraphs.content: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.

paragraphs.content: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name Jah, and rejoice before him.

paragraphs.content: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.

paragraphs.content: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.

paragraphs.content: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:

paragraphs.content: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

paragraphs.content: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.

paragraphs.content: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.

paragraphs.content: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.

paragraphs.content: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.

paragraphs.content: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.

paragraphs.content: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.

paragraphs.content: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.

paragraphs.content: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the Lord will dwell in it for ever.

paragraphs.content: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the Lord God might dwell among them.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.

paragraphs.content: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto God the Lord belong the issues from death.

paragraphs.content: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.

paragraphs.content: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:

paragraphs.content: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.

paragraphs.content: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.

paragraphs.content: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.

paragraphs.content: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.

paragraphs.content: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.

paragraphs.content: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.

paragraphs.content: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.

paragraphs.content: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.

paragraphs.content: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

paragraphs.content: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:

paragraphs.content: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.

paragraphs.content: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

paragraphs.content: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
